Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Tiessiri group have an average age of 43 and, on average, 3 children and all live in extended traditional families in Dieou Peulh, in the San Circle (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other via family relationships and they all buy and sell various products. The women of the Tiessiri group are on their first group loan.

Diomine, the woman on the far right of the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 10 pairs of earrings, 20 pairs of aluminium chains and 20 rubber necklaces. She gets her supplies in San. She makes her sales for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 10 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and education expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 pairs of earrings, 20 pairs of aluminium chains and 20 rubber necklaces.

loans.name: Zamiri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Aimerance est une vaillante commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires « Zamiri », senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 73 ans, veuve et mère de 4 enfants qui, 1 étudie et 3 autres sont déjà mariés. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe sa marchandise à son domicile devant son enclos, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari (lors de son vivant). Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 45 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1 sac de pomme de terre et 1 sac de farine de manioc, tomates,  25 poissons salés et les épices. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir son jeune étudiant. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant, ce moment critique post conflit à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Aimerance, the customer, is a hard-working saleswoman and a member of the Zamiri business group. An older, dynamic entrepreneur, she is 73 years old, widowed and the mother of 4 children, one of whom attends school and 3 of whom are already married. Aimerance sells food products. She displays her merchandise at home, in her front yard, where she has built up her clientèle. She started her business with funds she received from her husband (when he was alive). Later on, she benefited from a loan from the MFI Hekima. She has been in this line of work for 45 years. This new loan will enable her to buy a bag of potatoes, a bag of cassava flour, tomatoes, 25 dried fish and spices. She would like to build a house, and feed and educate her youngest child. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for enabling non-bankable female entrepreneurs to be self-sufficient, especially in this critical time after the war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy a bag of potatoes, a bag of cassava flour, tomatoes, 25 dried fish and spices.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: One Way Group

texts.en: Greetings are coming to you from members of the "One Way" group. They are very pleased to inform their numerous Kiva lenders that their previous Kiva loan has been very helpful in boosting their respective businesses and improving their well-being. Having repaid their last Kiva loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan in the amount of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to further increase their business inventories. Kumba is again the group's featured leader. She sells market food - palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. She will again use her share of this loan to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob lives and works close to Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's largest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting blue gum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Jacob is married, and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers, and they are currently farming maize, beans, sunflower and rearing livestock. He likes beekeeping because it is easy to do, and enjoys the support from Honey Care for their beekeeping solutions.
This is Jacob’s first loan, and his hope for the future is “to see my children get the very best education.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Arinolta

texts.en:
Mildred is 50-year-old mother from Kakamega, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She is a married to John and supports five people in her family that include her four children who are; 17, 15, 14 and 11 years old respectively.

She runs a small scale retail shop, and has been operating it for the last five years and generates a monthly income of KES. 5,000.

She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to add more stock of shop items. She will use the anticipated profits to open another retail shop so as to give her more income to support the family. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to add more stock of salt, cooking oil and sugar to her shop.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA ont en moyenne  34 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  DIEOU PEULH  dans le cercle de SAN (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.  Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire. ROKIA 3 eme femme debout à gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 5 paniers de banane et 3 paniers de papayes. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 6 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabougnouma Group are all around thirty-four years old and have an average of five children each.  They live in traditional, extended families in Dieou Peulh which is in the San region (the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).  The women know one another through family ties, and all work buying and selling various items.  

This will be the first group loan for these women.

Rokia (standing third from the left in the photo) will use her loan to buy 5 baskets of bananas and 3 baskets of papayas.  She buys her supplies in San, and sells to a mixed customer base, on a cash or credit basis.

Rokia expects to earn a monthly average of 6,000 francs CFA, which she will use for health costs, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJEKAFO ont en moyenne  49 ans, 7 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Lafiabougou dans la ville de  SAN (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments et restauration. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur 15ème prêt solidaire. KADIA 1ère femme à gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 100kgs de riz, 2 sacs d’oignons de 50Kgs et 50 Kg de farine de blé, 15 litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne à San. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo group have an average age of 49 and, on average, 7 children and all live in extended traditional families in Lafiabougou, in the town of San (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships and they buy and sell condiments and prepared food. The women of the Tiessiri group are on their 15th group loan, having correctly repaid the previous ones.

Kadia, the first woman on the left in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 100 kilos of rice, 2 50-kilo bags of onions, a 50-kilo bag of wheat flour and 15 litres of oil. She gets her supplies in San. She makes her sales locally for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 50 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing, lodging and education expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients with which to prepare meals.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BALIMAYA ont en moyenne  26 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO I dans La ville de  SAN (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers. Les femmes du groupe BALIMAYA sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire. BINTOU 1 ère femme debout  à gauche   sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 1 rouleau de tissus léger et 8 paires de chaussures en plastique. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 19.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Balimaya group have an average age of 26 and, on average, 2 children and all live in extended traditional families in Santoro I, in the town of San (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other thanks to family relationships and they buy and sell various products. The women of the Balimaya group are on their first group loan.

Bintou, the first woman on the left in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 1 roll of light fabric and 8 pairs of plastic shoes. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She makes her sales for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 19 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing, lodging and education expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 1 roll of light fabric and 8 pairs of plastic shoes.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  37 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO I dans la ville de  SAN (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 6ème prêt solidaire. SITAN  1ère femme à droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 10 pagnes wax, 20 paires collier en caoutchouc, 20 poupées et 20 jeux d’enfant.. Elle s’approvisionne à San. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi Group are around thirty-seven years old and have an average of six children.  They live in traditional, extended families in Santoro I, in the town of San (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).  The women know one another through family and neighbourhood ties, and they work buying and selling various products.

This will be the group's sixth group loan, the previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Sitan (on the right of the photo) will use her loan to buy 10 wax pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing), 20 rubber necklaces, 20 dolls and 20 children's toys.  She buys her supplies in San, and sells locally, to a mixed clientele  on a cash or credit basis.

Sitan expects to earn a monthly average of 25,000 francs CFA, which she will use to pay for health costs, food, clothes, rent, school fees, and the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various products for resale.

loans.name: Estrella Resplandeciente Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socias trabajadoras microempresarias una de ellas es María Elena tiene la edad de 57 años, casada, con tres hijos, su negocio es la venta de ropa desde hace 17 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 2 años, El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de mercadería como pantalones de hombre, pantalones de mujer, blusas, camisas, faldas, juego de sabanas. Marisela de 36 años de edad su negocio es la venta de comida en la zona franca, Teresa de 62 años  vende cosméticos de Avon y se dedica a la costura, Martha de 57 años su negocio es la costura.
texts.en: This group is made up of four hardworking micro-entrepreneur partners. One of them is María Elena, who is 57 years old and married with three children. Her business for the past 17 years has been sellling clothing. She has been a client of the institution for two years, and she is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as men's pants, women's pants, blouses, shorts, skirts, and sets of sheets. Marisela is 36 years old and has a business selling food in the tax-free zone. Teresa is 62, sells Avon cosmetics, and does sewing. Martha is 57 and her business is sewing.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of new clothing such as men's pants, women's pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, sets of sheets, etc.

loans.name: Magaly  Zulema

texts.es:
Magaly tiene 24 años de edad es de estado civil unión libre tiene 3 hijos vive con la familia en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla Virgen De Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche  que pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Magaly se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de animales como las gallinas. Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno y compra de insumos como abonos organicos e inorganicos.

Las compras  realiza en el cantón ventanas  frecuentemente en agripag. Su sueño es mejorar la producción de los cultivos. Se enfreta desafios como las plagas y enfremedades que se le presentan en el cultivo. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta ayudar a los hijos a estudiar y bailar con ellos.
texts.en:
Magaly is 24 years old. She's in a common law marriage and has three children. She lives with her family in the canton of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos. She's a member of the "Virgen de Guadalupe" communal bank, which is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which belongs to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. 

Magaly is a farmer who grows corn and raises animals such as chickens. She is requesting the loan in order to rent the farmland and to purchase supplies such as organic and inorganic fertilizers. She makes her purchases in the canton of Ventanas, often from a company called Agripag.

Her dream is to improve production in her crops. She faces challenges such as pests and diseases which affect the crops. In her free time she likes helping her children with their studies and dancing with them.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as organic and inorganic fertilizers.

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is a 30-year-old married mother of two children. She is a Palestinian refugee, who works hard for her living. Ibtissam is working hard to develop and run a clothes and shoe shop inside the Palestinian camp she is living. Ibtissam is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a focus on special winter needs. She wants to diversify her products and respond to her customers’ needs and requests. She will increase her clothes capital with newly released items for the coming Christmas and winter season. She will also start selling winter blankets and mattresses to expand her working sector.
This loan will provide her with a wide range of items that will help her in developing her business and covering her family's socioeconomic situation.
Ibtissam hopes that in the future she can expand her workplace and move to a larger one in the future. She is planning to provide her children with a better living and a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase winter shoes, newly released clothing items, winter blankets and mattresses.

loans.name: Laimah

texts.en: Twenty eight-year-old Laimah lives in one of the communities surrounding Airport. She is married to a driver, and has three children between 1 and 8 years old. Only two of them are currently in school and they all live at home. Over the past 6 years she has been selling candles, candy, biscuits, cookies, sugar, matches, etc. She enjoys the way customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more candles, candy, biscuits, cookies, sugar, matches, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more candles, candy, biscuits, cookies, sugar, matches, etc. for her business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives and works close to Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of the tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

James is married, and has two children. His wife farms their land full-time, while he divides his time between farming and acting as an assistant chief (a position in the municipal government) of a nearby sub-location. He and his wife have been farming for 10 years, and are currently growing maize, avocado, sugarcane, beans, bananas and sunflower on their land, as well as tending to a fruit orchard. The variety of crops on his farm, in particular his sunflower and fruit trees, will benefit his bee colonies, and James is looking forward to having honey of his own for home use.
This is James’ first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay for his children’s education and domestic expenses.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  29 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  DIEOU MARKA dans le cercle de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.  Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire. KARIA  1 ère femme  à gauche   sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 5 complets de wax réal et 3 complets d’uni wax. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 4 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Danaya Group average 29 years of age, 4 children, and all live in extended traditional families in Dieou Marka, in San Cercle, Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship. They buy and sell various products and are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Karia is the first woman from the left in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 8 pieces of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth), 5 "Real Wax" and 3 "Uni Wax".

She gets her supplies in San and resells, for cash and often on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 4'000, to be used to cover expenses related to healthcare and food. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 8 pieces of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies  dans la ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers. Les femmes du groupe sont à leur 1èr prêt solidaire. AWA femme debout au milieu  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 10 marmites, 15 douzaine de tasses, 5 douzaine d’assiettes. Elle s’approvisionne à San. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi Group are around thirty-four years of age, and have an average of three children.  They live in traditional, extended families in the town of San/Segou (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).  The women know one another through family and friendship, and work buying and selling various products.

This will be the first group loan for the Benkadi Group.

Awa (standing in the centre of the photo) will use her loan to buy 10 cooking pots, 15 dozen cups and 5 dozen plates.  She buys her supplies in San, and sells locally to a mixed customer base, for cash or credit.

She expects to earn a monthly average of 11,000 francs CFA, which she will use for health costs, food, clothes, rent, school fees and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABALI ont en moyenne  42 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO  dans la ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABALI sont à leur  7ème  prêt solidaire. FATOUMATA   2ème femme  à gauche   sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 2 rouleaux de bazin, 10 paires de boucles d’oreille, une douzaine de bracelets en caoutchouc. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 18 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabali group have an average age of 42 and, on average, 6 children and all live in extended traditional families in Santoro, in the town of San/Segou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other thanks to family relationships and friendships and they buy and sell various products. The women of the Balimaya group are on their 7th group loan, having correctly repaid the previous loans.

Fatoumata, the second woman from the left in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 2 rolls of damask fabric and 10 pairs of earrings and a dozen rubber bracelets. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She makes her sales locally for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 18 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare, lodging and education expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 rolls of damask fabric and 10 pairs of earrings and a dozen rubber bracelets.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  24 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à HAMDALLAYE dans la ville de  SAN (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 15ème prêt solidaire. KOTIMI 2ème femme à droite,  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 15 paires de chaussures en peau et 25 paires colliers en aluminium. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group have an average age of 24 and, on average, 2 children and all live in extended traditional families in Hamdallaye, in the town of San (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other thanks to family relationships and they buy and sell various products. The women of the Danaya group are on their 15th group loan, having correctly repaid the previous loans.

Kotimi, the second woman from the right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 15 pairs of leather shoes and 25 pairs of aluminium necklaces. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She makes her sales locally for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing, lodging and education expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of leather shoes and 25 pairs of aluminium necklaces.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABALY ont en moyenne 31 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DIEOU MARKA  dans le cercle de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers etc.
 Les femmes du groupe SABALY sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire. MINATA  2ème femme debout  à droite   sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter de 2 cartons de savon,  1 carton de pommades. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 6 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabaly group have an average age of 31 and, on average, 5 children and all live in extended traditional families in Dieou Marka, in the San/Segou Circle (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other thanks to family relationships and they buy and sell various products. The women of the Sabaly group are on their first group loan.

Minata, the woman standing second from the right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy two boxes of soap and one box of creams. She gets her supplies in San. She makes her sales for cash and often credit to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 6 000 francs, part of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and education expenses, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Rose Ernadette

texts.fr: rose est une femme de 33 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. elle possède et gère une alimentation où elle vend des boissons hygiéniques dans un quartier de la ville depuis 6 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des boissons a hauteur de 300000 francs afin de satisfaire sa cliente et augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans l'activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rose is thirty-three years old, single and has one child.  She owns and runs a food store where she has sold bottled drinks for six years.

She has requested this loan in order to build her stock of products for sale by buying 300,000 francs CFA worth of drinks.  This will help her satisfy the demands of her customers and increase her earnings.  

Rose will use her earnings to reinvest in her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock.

loans.name: Maria Jannet

texts.es:
María es una mujer activa y trabajadora, que se gana la vida trabajando como independiente, pues tiene un puesto de venta de comidas ubicado en una calle del centro de la ciudad, el oficio lo aprendió cuando trabajaba como empleada en un restaurante, donde obtuvo la experiencia y el conocimiento en las labores de la cocina y, con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos decidió independizarse, comprando un carro de comidas con la liquidación y algunos ahorros que tenía. De esta forma ha generado los ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y el sustento de sus 3 hijos, y para solventar los gastos médicos que requiere ya que se encuentra en estado de embarazo de su cuarto hijo.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas e insumos al por mayor (panes, carnes frías, arepas, chorizos, salsas, gaseosas, entre otros), esto con el fin de incluir nuevos productos para ofrecer a su clientela y aumentar así las ventas e ingresos que percibe con su labor, pues podrá satisfacer los diversos gustos  de los comensales.
El propósito de María es lograr que su negocio sea rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica para ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is an active and hardworking woman who makes her living working independently. She has a food stall located in a central street of the city. She learned this work when she was employed at a restaurant, where she learned and got experience working in the kitchen. With the incentive of making more income, she decided to become independent, and bought a food cart with her severance pay and some savings she had. In this way she has made enough money to support her husband with the household finances and in maintaining their three children, and to cover the medical expenses she has, as she is currently pregnant with her fourth child. 

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of a fast-food cart and wholesale supplies (breads, cold meats, arepas, sausages, sauces, soft drinks, and other items). Her aim is to offer new products to her customers and so increase her sales and the income she makes from her labor, as she will be able to cater to diverse tastes. 

María's goal is that her business be profitable and guarantee her economic stability, so she can offer her children a good education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a fast-food cart and wholesale supplies (breads, cold meats, arepas, sausages, sauces, and soft drinks, among other items)

loans.name: Edison

texts.es:
Edison es un hombre trabajador y pujante de 39 años de edad, felizmente casado y padre de un hijo de 10 años, por quien lucha cada día para sacarlo adelante.
Se desempeña como comerciante independiente, su negocio consiste en la venta de gafas, actividad que realiza de manera ambulante, se ubica en uno de los parques principales del centro de la ciudad pero, cuando las ventas disminuyen anda por las diferentes calles en busca de clientela. La actividad la desarrolla todos los días y tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en la labor. 
Con el propósito de fortalecer su negocio y seguir generando los ingresos para su familia, encuentra apoyo en el crédito que solicita, pues con el dinero comprará surtido al por mayor (gafas de sol), esto le permitirá tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos, dando como resultado un incremento notable en las ventas y en el nivel de ingresos que recibe.
Edison manifiesta que quiere cumplir el sueño de tener un local propio en el que pueda realizar su actividad de manera más cómoda, evitando todos los riesgos y desafíos que trae consigo el trabajo en la calle, de esta forma tendrá mejor rentabilidad y podrá brindar una buena educación a su hijo y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Edison, who is 39 years old, is a motivated and hard-working man. He is happily married and has a 10-year-old son. He works hard every day so he can bring him up properly. He works as an independent trader and has a business selling sunglasses as a street vendor. His pitch is located in one of the main parks in the city centre but when sales are low he walks around different streets looking for customers. He works every day and has been doing this for more than 10 years. 

In order to strengthen his business and continue earning an income for his family, he is finding support in the loan he is requesting. With the money he will buy stock (sunglasses) wholesale and this will enable him to have a better variety to offer his customers and satisfy their various tastes. As a result this will give him a significant increase in his sales and the amount of income he makes. 

Edison says that he wants to fulfil his dream of having his own place where he can carry out his business more comfortably, avoiding all of the risks and challenges which he faces while working in the street. This will make his business more profitable and will enable him to provide his son with a better education and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (sunglasses).

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona is a 47-years–old divorced woman with one child. She earns a living by breeding cows and cattle, selling their milk and milk products as well as meat to local butchers. She has had15 years of experience in this field, thanks to her father, who taught her how to look after cattle. Sona usually buys small cows, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a more profitable price to butchers. She sells milk and yogurt to neighbors. She earns about 180 AZN a month, in part because milk, yogurt, and meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. Now she is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy three milk cows. This will be her 4th loan.

loans.use: to buy three milk cows.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine lives in Hovq village. She lives together with her husband and two school age children. Lusine and her husband have been engaged in agriculture. The farm that they are running includes livestock and a plot of land where different types of vegetables are cultivated. The gathered harvest is sold in nearby open markets and the family earns income, which is vital for their living. Realizing the importance of agriculture, she would like to enlarge the farm. 

Lusine asks for this loan of USD735 to be able to purchase a calf and make previous credit repayments. The loan is very important for Lusine and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and make previous credit repayments.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald lives and works near Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, Kitale is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya”. Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies. Ronald is married, and has six children. Both his wife and him have been farming for twelve years now, and are currently growing maize, beans, millet and animal fodder on their land, as well as tending to trees. These young trees will be good sources of nectar for their bee colonies. This is Ronald’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay for his chlidren's school fees and buy some farm equipment.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 30 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have three children. With this loan, she would like to buy more rice and cooking oil for sale. The profits from her business will be used for as savings.

loans.use: to buy more rice and cooking oil for sale

loans.name: Gogita

texts.en: Gogita is a 41-year-old married man and lives in Matani, in the Akhmeta district. At home he has his 74-year-old pensioner mother. Gogita's wife lives abroad. They have 2 children, who live in a special education and rehabilitation center for disabled children, who have physical, mental and developmental disabilities. Gogita doesn't have his own job and now the only income for the family is his mother's pension. He couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows rural residents like Gogita to get a chance at starting or re-starting business. He requested a loan of 3,000 USD to open a Georgian traditional bakery. This will give him a chance to earn income and become financially independent. With the Start Up program Gogita will be able to earn savings and provide better future.

loans.use: to open Georgian national bakery.

loans.name: Salud Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal SALUD; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Mónica continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos de belleza como colonias, perfumes, cremas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cremas, perfumes entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, venta de productos naturales, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, docentes y trabajadores de empresas privadas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por  motivos de trabajo y salud.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Mónica belongs to the communal bank Salud, which is located in the district of Wanchaq, in Cusco province, department of Cusco. Mónica still has her business selling beauty products. She has been working in this business for several years and it brings her personal and financial satisfaction. She sells various types of beauty products such as perfume, fragrances, creams, and other products. She wants to carry on working so she can continue to support her family in this way.

Mónica is requesting this loan in order to buy creams, perfumes and other items.

The other members work renting rooms, selling natural products, selling clothing, selling cosmetics, teaching, and as private company employees. The members who appear in the attached photos asked for permission to arrive late at the meeting for work and health-related issues.

Mónica is grateful for the loan granted and promises to comply with the terms of her payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes and other items.

loans.name: Oroberesoromandi Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAFIORA représente le groupe OROBERESOROMANDI. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a30ans et le moins âgé a 18ans. 01 va à l’école. 
Mme fait la poterie depuis 40ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Tougan au Burkina. Ses clients sont les vendeurs en gros et détails (hommes et femmes).
Elle veut s’acheter 30charettes d’argile.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un  motocycle et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Safiora is the representative for the Oroberesoromandi Group.  She is doing very well.  She is married and has five children, the eldest is thirty years old and the youngest is eighteen years old.  One of her children attends school.

Safiora has been making pottery for forty years.  She buys her supplies in Tougan, Burkina Faso, and sells her products to wholesalers and retailers (men and women).

She will use her loan to buy 30 cartloads of clay.  Safiora will reinvest her earnings in her business.

In the future, she would like to buy a motorcycle and provide more for her family.

loans.use: to buy 30 cartloads of clay for her pottery business.

loans.name: Sababougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mme AZILA JUDITH représente le groupe SABABOUGNOUMA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère d’un enfant. Il est âgé de 03 ans. Il va à l’école (maternelle).
Mme vend du combustible depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne par livraison à domicile. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes du quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 03 rangées de bois.
Elle veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Azila Judith represents the Sababougnouma Group.  She is doing very well.  She is married and has one child, aged three years.  Her child attends nursery school. 

Azila Judith has been selling firewood for ten years.  She has her supplies delivered to her house, and sells to local men and women.

She will use her loan to buy 3 rows of firewood, this will help to improve her business and, therefore, her earnings.

Azila Judith would like to improve her business finances and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 3 rows of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three beautiful girls. She is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has six years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person. Bahar usually sells her crops to the market vendors in her area. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of an Azerbaijan family and also makes fresh punch. Her monthly income is 100 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength, in addition to working in the open air. This is very hard work, and that's why her husband is helping her in this business. 

She needs additional money to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products and raise her monthly turnover. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN. This will be her second loan.

loans.use: to invest in seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Saima  Naaz

texts.en: Saima Naaz is a married woman. She has been running a tailoring business for the past 3 years. She is an expert in stitching stylish dresses for women. She has 4 children, who are all going to school. Her husband's income is insufficient for their household expenses. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses this income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her 3rd loan cycle and has previously borrowed Rs 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. Her repayment record is very good. She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new stitching machine as well as some raw material such as cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zips etc, to create a means of increasing revenues, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She also educates young girls in her community about stitching techniques.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine and some raw material such as cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zips

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en: Manzooran is a 47-years-old married woman and the mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has now become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her milk sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Raweltaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme HABIBOU représente le groupe RAWELTAABA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge. 
Mme fait maintenant la restauration (du tô) depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes de son secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sacs de maïs pour la préparation du tô.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne augmenter  son chiffre d’affaire et  scolariser  ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Habibou represents Raweltaaba Group. She is doing well. She's married and the mother of six children. The eldest is 25 years old and the youngest is five. Four of them go to school. She has two dependents.

She's been running a food serving business for the last four years, selling "tô" (a local dish consisting of a ball of millet or corn served in a sauce). She gets her supplies at the market in her sector. Her customers are men and women from her area.

She wants to buy one sack of corn to make "tô". She wants to save her earnings in order to strengthen her business. She ambitions to increase her revenue and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy one sack of corn to prepare a local dish called "tô"

loans.name: Rosee Matinale 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Roselande est la coordinatrice de son groupe Rosee Matinale de Ouanaminthe.  
Elle n’est pas mariee et elle a trois enfants. Elle habite dans la region nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de Léau portable est très limitée .

Roselande contient la boutique pendant les 4 dernieres années. Avant de faire ce commerce Elle fait la couture.  elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. Des autres membres de son groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour faire le commerce tel que ventes produits alimentaires, boissons gazeuses, charbon, nourriture etc. 

Elle son défit principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante dans sa vie. Elle dit son but principal c'est d'avoir un plus grand business qui lui facilitera à un plus grand trafique avec les prêts de Esperanza.
texts.en:
Roselande is the group coordinator for the 'Rosee Matinale de Ouanaminthe' Group.  She is not married, and has three children.  She lives in the north-east region of Haïti, where electricity is rare and drinking water is very scarce.

Roselande has been running a clothes shop for the past four years.  Prior to this she was a seamstress.  She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business.

The other members of the group will use their loans for their businesses, buying and selling food products, fizzy drinks, charcoal, food, etc.

Roselande's main ambition is to become a bigger trader during her lifetime, and continue to work with the field partner, Esperanza.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Isaac

texts.es: El señor Jorge habitante del municipio de Masaya, casado padre de 3 niños en edades escolares, se dedica a al actividad comercial ya que es propietario de un taller de Mecanica Automotriz, su esposa se dedica a las tareas del hogar. el credito lo solicita para la compra de Materiales de Construccion como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques ya que desea mejorar la infraestuctura del taller. agradece el apoyo que Kiva le ha brindado atravez de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in the town of Masaya. He is married and father of three children of school-age. He is engaged in commercial activities and is proprietor of an car repair shop. His wife takes care of the household tasks.

He is asking for a loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, iron, and bricks because he wants to make improvements to his shop. 

He is thankful for the help Kiva has given him through Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Divine Group

texts.fr:
Mr  DAOUDA représente le groupe DIVINE.  Il est célibataire sans enfant. Il a 01 personne en charge. 
Mr  est gérant d’un kiosque depuis 05ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son secteur. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter  01sac de riz, 05cartons de spaghetti  et  01 bidon d’huile.
Mr  veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de réinvestir dans son activité. Il  ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Daouda represents the Divine Group.  He is single and has no children, however, he is financially responsible for one other person.  

Daouda has run a kiosk for five years.  He buys his supplies locally and sells to men and women.

He will use his loan to buy 1 sack of rice, 5 boxes of spaghetti and 1 drum of oil.

Daouda will save his earnings in order to reinvest in his business in the future.  He would like to expand his business and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of rice, 5 boxes of spaghetti and 1 drum of oil.

loans.name: Angie Vanessa

texts.es:
Es una niña juiciosa desde  pequeña se hizo a una meta de lo que quiere en su futuro, ha estado rodeada de personas que han querido apagar los sueños y aun así quiere alcanzar los sueños, ella dice que lo inalcanzable para otros es alcanzable para Dios y el tiene un propósito para con ella y el lo hará, cuando estaba pequeña le preguntaban que  quería hacer cuando grande y siempre tuvo definido lo que quería.  Ella se merece lo mejor , termino el bachillerato  y continúa con las  expectativas y se proyecta para el futuro, quiere ser médica cirujana, tiene una opción de instrumentación quirúrgica, pero los padres no están en condiciones de pagar, por este motivo quiere iniciar con auxiliar de enfermería.
En el proyecto de ella, la salud de otros es una prioridad, salvar vidas o rescatarlas de la enfermedad. Esto la motiva a lograr lo que quiere.
Con la ayuda de campo alto y kiva agradece esa oportunidad y esto será el inicio de los sueños, sueños que con ayuda de Dios los podrá  alcanzar es una niña joven para iniciar y para continuar, y  eso es lo importante, iniciar. 
Gracias por la oportunidad
texts.en:
This is a sensible girl who since childhood had a goal of what she wanted for her future. She has been surrounded by people who wanted her to quit her dreams, but nevertheless she is striving to fulfill them. She says that what is unattainable for others is achievable for God, and he has plans with her which he will see through.

When she was still small and asked what she wanted to be in the future, she always knew definitely what she wanted. She deserves the best. She finished high school and still keeps to her expectations and plans for the future. She wants to be a surgeon and has the option to choose a surgery training program, but her parents cannot pay for this, therefore she wants to start with nurse's aide training.

In her plans, the health of other is a priority and she wants to save lives and heal. This motivates her to achieve her goals.

With the help of Kiva and CampoAlto, she appreciates having the opportunity to begin pursuing her dreams.  With the help of God, she will be able to achieve them. She is a young woman who is starting and continuing down that path, and so it is important that she get started.

Thank you for the opportunity.

loans.use: to pay the fee for one term.

loans.name: Naciba

texts.en: Naciba is a 45-years-old married person.She is raising 2 children with her husband. Naciba is a hardworking person who takes care of her family by doing business in animal husbandry. She raises cattle to sell their meat. Naciba has been in this business for 12 years now. Her husband supports her   in the business. The business takes a lot of effort, but together they run it successfully. She sells the meat in the central bazaar, where the demand for meat is high. People in Azerbaijan consume plenty of meat because it is used in most dishes. Some traditional meals like kebabs, dolma and others require beef in their preparation. Her profit is 130 AZN monthly. Now Naciba is applying for second loan of 2000 AZN, in order to buy new calves and expand her business. She plans to raise these calves, fatten them and sell more meat for the coming traditional holidays, when the demand for beef will increase. Naciba awaits your support

loans.use: to buy new calves and expand her business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 57 years old. She is married with seven children. She has been dealing in selling construction materials for the past four years. With this loan, she would like to buy more construction materials such as galvanized iron sheets, cements and paintings for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children’s school fees as well as providing food for her family.

loans.use: to buy galvanized iron sheets, cements and paintings for sale

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 34 year old farmer living in Kitale with his wife and 5 school-aged children.  He has farmed for 15 years to produce and sell milk, maize, and vegetables in the local market.  He also has a motorbike and offers transportation services to the local people.  This helps him to earn some extra income.  

He expressed the joy that he gets from farming and the income earned from his hard work on the farm.  His greatest challenge is how to deal with the pests and diseases that affect his crops and livestock.

Samwel chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it helps small scale farmers to increase their income and receive a lot of training before they are given loans.

This loan will help him earn more income which he will use to educate his children and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Sambu

texts.en: Sambu lives and works near Cherengani, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. Sambu is married and has one child. He is a relatively new farmer, having only farmed for three years, and he is currently growing maize on his land as well as maintaining natural forest cover. This natural forest cover will be very beneficial to his beehives, as it will allow the bees almost constant access to the flowers they need to make honey. This is Sambu’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay for his family needs.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 40-years-old married woman who has running a business of selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes in milk and she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from their milk.  She looks after her buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. She has four daughters and two sons, five of them whom are school going. She needs to earn more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make bigger profits, she has requested for a loan of Rs 45,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater for more customers. She hopes to increase her earnings through her larger sales.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson lives and works near Cherengani, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. Jackson is married and has four children. Both him and his wife have been farming for fifteen years now, and are currently growing maize, beans and millet on their land. Jackson is a very proud member of his local Community Based Organization and was happy to learn of the opportunity to get beehives on loan. He would like to thank everyone who makes his loan possible, as he is excited to start beekeeping. This is Jackson’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay for his children’s education and start new projects on his land.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 27 years old and married with two children. She resells different items such as utensils. With the loan, Clementine will use the loan to buy more utensils for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more utensils for resale.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 28 years old. She is married with one child. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for one year now. With this loan, Alphonsine wants to buy more sorghum and cassava for sale. She plans to use the profits for reinvesting into her business.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Angel Auelio

texts.es:
Angel tiene 37 años de edad  es divorciado vive con sus padres en el Cantón  Ventas Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe  que se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche  perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de cerdos y vacas que producen leche. Solicita el crédito para la comprar se semilla de maiz, fertilizantes y comprar de polvillo y vacunas para evitar enfermedades a los animales. 

Las compras lo realiza en Ventanas y Quevedo. Su sueño es la compra mas cerdos para aumentar la produccior ya que esto ha aumentado el ingreso a la familia.

El desafío que enfrenta son las plagas y enferedades como el cogollero que afecta a la flor.
texts.en:
Angel is 37 years old, divorced, and lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas, which is in Los Ríos Province. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Guadalupe”, which is in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. Angel is a farmer who grows corn and raises pigs and dairy cows.

Angel is requesting a loan to buy corn seed and fertilizers as well as "polvillo" [an animal feed made from rice] and vaccines to prevent diseases in the animals. 

His purchases are conducted in Ventanas and Quevedo. Angel’s dream is to buy more pigs to increase his production since this has increased the family's income.

The challenges he faces are pests and diseases such as the maize budworm which affects the flower.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizers, animal feed and vaccines to prevent diseases in the animals.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 44 years old and he operates a farming business. He lives simply with his wife and one child. Every day, he goes to the field to monitor his farm. He is grateful because he has been able to run his farming business well. Domingo sees to it that his responsibility to his family and farming business are in balance. 

As of now, Domingo is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 as additional working capital in operating his farm. He will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. He knows that these farm inputs that he will apply to his farm land will enable him to obtain a better yield and income. This will enable him to provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use for his farming business.

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 30 años de edad es de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo vive con sus padres en Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Ríos.

Es integrante de la ventanilla de la Virgen de Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicado en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al cantó Pueblo Viejo.

Eduardo se dedica a la venta y ala siembra de maíz y arroz y a la crianza de pollos.Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno y la compra de insumos fertilizantes ademas controles biologicos es decir la curacion de pplantas e insectos.

La compra lo realiza en Ventanas y los vende en la misma localidad. Su sueño es seguir adelante con los cultivos y aumentar la produccion. Los desafios son las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 30 years old. He has a partner and a son and lives with his parents in the Ventanas settlement within the Rios province. He is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe group, located in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the Pueblo Viejo. 

Eduardo grows and sells corn and rice and raises chickens. He is asking for this loan so that he can rent a plot of land and buy supplies such as fertilizers and biological controls to keep his plants free of insects.

He makes his purchases in Ventanas and he makes his sales in the same place. His dream is to make progress with his crops and increase his production. The challenges he faces are the pests and diseases which affect his crops.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers and biological controls to keep his plants free of insects.

loans.name: Join Hand Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Join Hand” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Hawa. Hawa is age 27. She was born in Sandor, a town in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and the couple has 1 child. Hawa sells market food - palm-oil (the country's most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. and has been doing this business for 6 years now. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy additional palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a 40-year-old married person who has two sons. Ilham is an IDP (internally displaced person). He has worked very hard his whole life. He is a simple farmer who works tirelessly to provide for his family. Each year, he sets some new goals for himself. And, thanks to his perseverance, he achieves them.

Ilham's objective is to be a serious farmer. With this goal in mind, he has requested a loan of 2,000 AZN and he is hoping to receive your help. Having had cattle at home for domestic use for many years, he knows everything there is to know about livestock and raising cattle. He has to provide the animals' feed and will raise the crops himself this year, as the cost is expensive at the bazaar in the cold months.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Lamiyya

texts.en:
Lamiyya is a 33-year-old married woman with 2 children. She   is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her  family in the Bilasuvar  IDP Settlement. 

When she was 30, her parents taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. She has grown vegetables and fruits for more than 3  years.

Lamiyya’s   income from her business is 150 AZN. In order to increase the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. She believes that her sons will help her to expand the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, she wants the business to continue and prosper. 

Lamiyya needs 2,000 AZN loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and fruit trees. Her biggest wish is to offer her sons an education . This is going to be her 2nd  loan.  Lamiyya hopes that Kiva will help  her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and fruit trees.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta lives in Magibi County which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is 34 years old, unmarried and has two children ages 1 and 9-years-old. The older child is in school and they all live at home. 

Over the past 10 years she has been selling bitter ball and pepper in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and learned this way of selling from her. Satta is requesting a loan to purchase bitterer ball and pepper for her business. She wants to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en: Asmat, 59-years-old, is from the small village of Telavi district. She works as a baker at local bakery. In addition, she trades clothes. Asmat has satisfied clients who regularly give her orders. Now she needs money to purchase a additional clothes for the winter season. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $ 600 for purchasing inventory. As the new clothes are purchased she will raise the turnover and thus her income will be increased. The revenue generated from sales will be reinvested in the same business. The Start Up program will be a great support for Asmat.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 31 years old. She is married with four children. Her husband works as a businessman. With this loan, she would like to buy more foodstuffs for sale such as sorghum. The profits from her business will be used for making more savings.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Joannah

texts.en: Joannah live in the communities surrounding the airport in Margibi County, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is 23 years old. She is single with three children, of whom two are attending school and they all live at home with her. Joannah stopped school in the per-nursery stage. Over the past five years she has been selling oil and plantain in the local market. Joannah spends most of her time with her business since it helps to sustain her family. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and plantain for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil and plantain for her business.

loans.name: Ghana Group

texts.en: This group is called Ghana and is made up of four women, who belong to the same savings group. They live in Taiz, Yemen. This group is requesting financial assistance from Kiva partner AMB in order to raise their level of activity. They have applied for a loan of 140,000 YER. Fatehia is the group's representative. She is a 28-year-old woman. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned for the well-being of her family, who are now living in a partially-finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed.  She has therefore requested a loan from AMB, which she will use to buy construction materials in order to finish building her house. Fatehia states that she feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that she is being provided, because in this way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 31 years old and living in the Airport Community. She is unmarried with 2 children, who live at home with her and attend school. Fatu has been selling for a while now, and presently she is selling ice and cool water. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and learned this method of selling from her. She is appreciative of her business because it keeps her saving every day. Her plans are to build a house, and educate her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ice and cool water for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ice and cool water for her business.

loans.name: Maisara

texts.ru:
Майсара молодая девушка в возрасте 28 лет. Имеет одного ребенка. С связи с обстоятельствами у нее личная жизнь не сложилась. В данное время она с мужем в разводе. Она одна воспитывает  ребенка. Проживает Майсара в родительском доме. Майсаре отделили половину дома и  она проживает там  с ребенком.
 Майсара не где не училась, у нее нету высшего образования. Но она очень трудолюбивая, стремительная девушка. Майсара занимается шитьем. Она шьет национальные платья для местных жителей. В свободное время от работы Майсара ходит на подработку в поле на прополку. 
Связи с  наступлением  холодов  Майсара хочет   отремонтировать крышу так как в прошлом году всю зиму крыша протекала. На данный момент у Майсары нету денежных средств на покупку строительных материалов и она решила обратится за кредитом в Арванд. Она надеется, что ей помогут и поддержат финансово.
texts.en:
Maisara is a young, 28-year-old mother-of-one and divorcée.  She lives with her parents, who were kind enough to take her in after her divorce and give her a place to stay and raise her child.  Though she's never gone to college, she's hardworking and driven to succeed.  She currently works as a seamstress, making and selling Tajikistani dresses to the locals in her area.  When she's not making dresses, she earns some extra money on the side removing weeds on people's farms.

The roof on Maisara's house has been damaged for some time, and has yet to repaired; with the onset of winter this year, and remembering how badly the roof was leaking last winter, Maisara would like to repair it, but lacks the money to do so.  As such, she's seeking a loan from Arvand to buy the necessary materials to repair her roof, and hopes they'll be able to help her.

loans.use: buy building materials to repair her roof

loans.name: Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTIAGO”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Wilma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado y queso, venta de carne, venta de repuestos de autos, pesca, venta de charque (carne deshidrata), tienda de barrio, venta de pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Wilma es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescados; cuenta que este negocio lo implemento por recomendación de su madre quien le enseño este negocio desde niña, cuando formo su familia decide comenzar con el mimo negocio independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de redes y pescado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las comunidades aledañas a su domicilio y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el pago del crédito que ofrece la institución.

En la fotografía no se encuentra una señora, porque tuvo que ir a su negocio con urgencia
texts.en:
The Santiago group is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana. It is formed by nine members and is headed by a board, of which Wilma is the president. The members' businesses are varied and amongst them are the sale of fish and cheese, the sale of meat, the sale of auto parts, fishing, the sale of charque (a type of jerky), neighbourhood shops and the sale of fish.

The loan they are requesting will help microentrepreneurs, one of which is Wilma. She has been a part of Pro Mujer for a year, joining at the invitation of a promoter of the institution who visited her home. She currently has a fish selling business, which she started at the recommendation of her mother, who taught her how to do this since she was a child. Since she started her own family she decided to start her own business independently.
 
This loan will be used for the purchase of fishnets and fish, which will be bought from wholesale sellers from the neighbourhoods close to her house, and will be sold at her shop. This line of work helps her generate income to sustain her home, since Wilma lives with her partner and has four children. 

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, she answered that she she likes the loans offered by the institution.

One of the members is missing from the picture because she had to attend to her business due to an emergency.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and fish

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives near Cherengani, in the Kitale region which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. 

This area was originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century and the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. As a result, Trans-Nzoia is one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale an excellent beekeeping region.

Jane is married, and has seven children. She has farmed for fifteen years, and  grows maize, beans, millet, bananas and amaranth. Jane is excited to become a beekeeper because it is a project with low labor and good income. 

This is Jane’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials to support honey production.

loans.name: Bernarda De Lourdes

texts.es: Doña Bernarda es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, soltera  y madre de tres hijos ya independientes. Tiene 53 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y comida. Inicio su negocio hace varios años,y poco a poco fue ampliando su negocio en otras áreas de la ciudad. Su meta próxima es seguir ampliando su negocio. Solicita el crédito para la compra de Ropa, Artículos del hogar, Artículos escolares, entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es ampliar su negocio con nuevos productos e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Bernarda comes from the city of Granada. She is 53, single, and has three children who are now independent. She works as a vendor, selling clothing and food. She started her business several years ago and she gradually expanded it in other areas of the city. Her next goal is to continue to grow her business.

Bernarda is asking for the loan to buy clothing, household items and school and other items. She thinks the loan will be a great help to her to meet the needs of her customers. Her plan for the future is to widen the business with new products and to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, household items and school and other items.

loans.name: Ricardo Junior

texts.es: Ricardo un joven de 19 años que estudia hace 02 años  la carrera de Mecánica Automotriz en un instituto de prestigio. Con la idea de contar con una profesión y motivado por sus familiares decide estudiar dicha carrera. Sus padres son los que lo apoyan con sus estudios. Terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y ser un profesional competitivo es su meta.
