Ricardo solicitó el crédito para la compra de materiales como uniformes y zapatos de seguridad  que le piden para poder realizar sus prácticas. Ricardo agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada y motiva a seguir apoyando a jóvenes emprendedores como él.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 19, is a young man who is in the second year of his studies in Auto Mechanics in a renowned school. He started studying aiming to become a professional and motivated by his family.

His parents support his studies. His goal is to finish his studies and become a competitive professional.

Ricardo requested a loan to buy supplies such as uniforms and safety shoes, which are required for different training sessions. Ricardo appreciates the help that Kiva lenders have given him and invites them to continue supporting enterprising young people like him.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as uniforms and safety shoes.

loans.name: Sixto Valerio

texts.es:
Sixto tiene 46 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene un seis hijos vive con la compañera y con los hijos  en Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Ríos. 

Es integrante de la ventanilla de la Virgen de Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicado en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al cantó Pueblo Viejo. 

Sixto se dedica a la venta y ala siembra de maíz y arroz y a la crianza de pollos.Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno y la compra de insumos fertilizantes ademas controles biologicos es decir la curacion de plantas e insectos. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas y los vende en la misma localidad. Su sueño es seguir adelante con los cultivos y aumentar la produccion. 

Los desafios son las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos.
texts.en:
Sixto is 46 years old. He has a partner and six children and they all live with his parents in the Ventanas settlement within the Rios province. He is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe group, located in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the Pueblo Viejo canton. 

Sixto grows and sells corn and rice and raises chickens. He is asking for this loan so that he can rent a plot of land and buy supplies such as fertilizers and biological controls to take care of plants and insects.

He makes his purchases in Ventanas and he makes his sales in the same place. His dream is to make progress with his crops and increase his production. The challenges he faces are the pests and diseases which affect his crops.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers as well as biological controls to take care of plants and insects.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice lives and undertakes farming in Kitale with his wife and eight children. He has been farming for 10 years. He produces and sells milk, eggs and maize. He loves doing dairy farming the most. His greatest business challenge is livestock diseases.

Maurice chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer their loans at a lower interest rate and the repayment is easily achievable. During the training offered, he learned how to develop a lifestyle of saving. His highest monthly expense is school fees. This loan will enable him to buy a dairy cow. It will bring a lot of improvement to his livelihood and will enable him to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. 

Her husband is a very hardworking and honest person; he owns a small restaurant in which he offers delicious foods. His customers bring their meals through parcel and suggest that he offer milk as well because there is no milk shop nearby. According to his customer’s demands, he wants to offer milk but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk to sell. 

Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy milk to sell at the restaurant. She thanks Kiva and appreciates the warmth and support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell at her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BENKADI est constitué de 5 femmes  mariées et 1 célibataire ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  MASABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5éme prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments à l’image de MAH qui est la 1ére femme   dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, diverses qualités et quantités de condiments avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of 5 married women and 1 unmarried woman who have an average age of 34 years and an average of 3 children each. They live in traditional extended families in the Masablacoura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni. The women came to know each other as neighbors, friends, and through their businesses.

In order to increase their financial capacity and better run their businesses, the women partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their fifth group loan. Their four previous loans have been fully repaid.

Mah, the woman pictured on the far right of the photo, is in the business of selling spices. She plans to use her loan to purchase large quantities of spices from wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and from her home, at retail for cash and for credit to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA which she will reinvest in her business and use to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BENKADI est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de35 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  DIALANIKORO de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3éme prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  gâteaux à l’image de  HABY qui est la 2 éme femme   dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 25 Kg de farine de blé et du sucre avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of 4 married women with an average age of 35 years and an average of 2 children each. They live in traditional extended families in the Dialanikoro neighborhood of the city of Bougouni. The women came to know each other as neighbors, friends, and through their businesses.

In order to increase their financial capacity to better run their businesses, the women partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their third group loan. Their two previous loans have been fully repaid.

Haby sells cakes and is the second woman from the left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to purchase 25kg of wheat flour and some sugar from wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and from her home, at retail for cash and for credit to a customer base made up of both men and women. Haby hopes to earn an average monthly salary of 30,000 francs CFA which she will reinvest in her business and use to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and sugar to make cakes

loans.name: Saramaya Group

texts.fr:
SARAMAYA est un groupe de l’association SANOUYA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente  de cosmétique, de céréales et de friperie à l’image de NASSOUN  qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
NASSOUN, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  1balle de friperie.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako  auprès des grossistes  et effectue ses ventes à  OUELESSEBOUGOU en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Saramaya is a borrowing subgroup of Sanouya of Ouelessebougou. It is made up of 4 women who came to know each other through relatives and friends. They are on average 35 years old and married with 4 children. The women are in various businesses such as the purchase and sale of cosmetics, cereals, and used clothing, which is the business carried on by Nassoun, pictured on the far left of the photo.

The women live in traditional extended families in Ouelessebougou in the Kati area (in the Koulikoro region of Mali.) They have been in business for many years and are very much sought after in their respective businesses.

In order to better meet the needs of their growing customer base, the members of the group decided to partner with the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Nassoun plans to use her loan to purchase 1 pack of used clothing. She stocks up in Bamako from wholesalers and makes her sales in Ouelessebougou at retail, for cash and for credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. Nassoun hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA which will allow her to pay back the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing

loans.name: Felecitte

texts.en: Felecitte is 29 years old. She is a mother of two children. With the loan, she would like to buy more items to sell in her boutique, such as sugar and used shoes. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and used shoes for sale.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a 28-year-old lady from Shienwe which is in the western part of Kenya.  She supports three people in her family and has a six year old child .

She has a sewing machine and has had a tailoring business for the last two years.  She earns a monthly income of  2,000 KES.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya to purchase materials for sewing and clothing projects.  She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business. Her dream is to open a big shop and a boutique  and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Isaack lives and works close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Isaack is married and has five children. Both him and his wife have been farming for sixty years and are currently growing maize, trees, beans, a fruit orchard and rearing livestock. He says he likes beekeeping because, “I will not strain to look after them” and is happy to have purchased hives because, “I will enjoy honey in my old age because of them.”

This is Isaack’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to cater for his health needs. His hope for the future is “to see my young grandchildren succeed in life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel lives near Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the bread basket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Nathaniel is married and has five children. His wife works as a teacher while Nathaniel engages in projects on their land. He has been farming for 20 years and is currently growing maize, sunflower, beans, bananas and oranges as well as tending to livestock. He is excited to start beekeeping because the bees will help pollinate his crops (particularly his sunflowers, oranges and bananas), leading to higher yield and quality. 

This is Nathaniel’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to invest in new projects on his land.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 33 years old and lives in Margibi County, which is the largest rubber-producing area of Liberia. She is married and has three children between 3 to 15 years old, all of whom are currently in school and live at home. For the past 13 years, Florence has been running a table selling rice, palm oil, pepper, vita, etc. in the market. She enjoys the way customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, vita, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, vita, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Cherengani, close to Kitale town which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. Trans-Nzoia is one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region allows farmers to grow a variety of crops including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale an excellent beekeeping region.

Josephine is married and has seven children. Both she and her husband have been farming for fifteen years and grow maize, beans and bananas on their land. 

This is Josephine’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her beehives to pay for domestic expenses. In the future, she hopes to expand her range of farming activities, maybe even starting a livestock project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials to support honey production.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina lives near Cherengani, in the Kitale region which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon (an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border).

Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests.  Area residents have maintained the area's tree cover to help preserve the region’s soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Albina is married and has five children. She and her husband have farmed for ten years and  grow maize, bananas and vegetables. Albina looks forward to becoming a beekeeper because the bees will help pollinate her crops and will also produce honey for her family to eat. 

This is Albina’s first loan and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials to support honey production.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 33 years old and married with six children.  Her husband works as a businessman.

She sells different merchandise such as tents, brooms, and Jerrycans.  She will use this loan to buy more brooms, Jerrycans and tents for resale.  She plans to use the profits to reinvest in the same business.  She is very happy with the previous loan because it helped her to develop a business to sell quality products.

loans.use: to buy brooms, Jerrycans, and tents for resale.

loans.name: Ioseb

texts.en:
Ioseb is a 30-year-old married man who lives in the small village of Pshaveli, Telavi district. He lives with his wife, 4 children and parents.  Ioseb's parents receive a retirement pension. 

He has been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood because his parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. Ioseb's wife is a housekeeper and looks after the children. They have 3 cows, a horse and 8 pigs.

Ioseb works hard to improve his family's living conditions. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enable Ioseb to get a loan of 2,500 GEL to start a pharmacy business. He wants to open the pharmacy to supply villagers with medicine. This loan will be a great support for the family. Ioseb is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to open a pharmacy.

loans.name: Foubou

texts.fr: Foubou est un homme de 57 ans marié, père de famille. Il est commerçant depuis 4 ans dans un quartier de la capitale où il vend du bois de chauffage, de la scuire et fait aussi un peu d'élévage. Il y'a des périodes où ce n’est pas facile de vendre du bois ce qui l'inquiète souvent et il devient difficile de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille dont il a la charge. C'est pour cette raison qu'il veut acheter en plus de la provende et des porcs  pour revendre en cette période de fêtes de fin d'année. Ceci l'aidera à économiser pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille pendant les périodes dures et le reste sera réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Foubou is a 57-year-old man who is married and the father of a family. He has been in business for 4 years in a neighborhood of the capital where he sells firewood, leather, and also raises animals. There are times when it is not easy to sell wood, which worries Foubou and it becomes difficult to provide for the needs of his family which he supports.

It is for this reason that Foubou wants to purchase additional feed and pigs to resell during this festival period at the end of the year. This will help him to save for providing for his family's needs during the difficult periods, and the remainder will be reinvested in his business in order to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and pigs

loans.name: Trabajando Para  El Futuro Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Trabajando Para El Futuro” conformada por 07 socias activas y emprendedoras que buscan mejorar cada día.  Sandra de 45 años es casada y tiene 03 hijos 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Sandra se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, negocio la cual lo realiza a pedidos siendo sus mayores clientes familiares y vecinos de la zona. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de cremas, colonias, bisuterías y talcos. Aperturar su propia tienda de prendas de vestir es su mayor anhelo. El grupo “Trabajando Para El Futuro” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Sandra se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo negro.
texts.en:
The “Trabajando Para El Futuro” community bank is made up of 7 active and enterprising women who seek to improve their lives every day. Sandra is 45 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still dependent on her. Sandra makes a living selling beauty products, which are ordered from her mainly by family and neighbours in the area. 

She will use this latest loan to buy cream, perfume, costume jewelry and talcum powder. Her greatest desire is to open her own clothes shop. 

The “Trabajando Para El Futuro” group is grateful to those people who made this loan possible, and are committed to continuing to work hard. Sandra is the first one sitting down on the left side of the photo in a black top..

loans.use: to buy cream, perfume, costume jewelry and talcum powder

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
Esta carta constituye una vez más una prueba de la personalidad emprendedora y el talento pujante de una mujer que cree en sí misma y que construye el futuro.
Desde pequeña siempre ha valorado lo que tiene, pero no se conforma, sabe que el mundo tiene más para ofrecerle y no quiere negarse partes del mundo, al igual que conoce el potencial y sabe que puede aportar un grano de arena a la construcción de un mejor país; como a muchos en este país cuando toma la bandera de la vida de ella, se enfrenta con obstáculos que intentan impedir alcanzar las metas, sin embargo la perseverancia, el optimismo y la siempre incondicional ayuda  que le restan la gente incondicional y desinteresada  que vienen a lo largo del camino, van articulando las condiciones necesarias para que surja incluso de la más oscura sombra el retoño de el sueño.
Xiomara, que es quien escribe esta carta, crecio en un barrio un poco pesado y duro para una niña como ella, pero este no es el final que le aguarda, ella se dispuso a recorrer el camino difícil, a no dejarse llevar por la corriente, se fijó una meta y empezó a trabajar por ella, quiere ser médico y ayudar a los niños de la comunidad donde vive, hacer lo posible por asegurar a esos niños una ventana de oportunidad para que cumplan los inocentes sueños que los definen; actualmente  se encuentra estudiando enfermería, cursa tercer semestre y se encuentra más motivada que nunca, las expectativas que tenía al principio han sido cumplidas todas satisfactoriamente, ahora tiene la certeza de encontrarse en la senda que quería, se propuso recorrer todo el camino hasta el final, es por eso que aunque  hoy día trabaja como asistente domestica medio turno, recibiendo medio sueldo para pagar el boleto hacia el sueño que tiene, sin embargo este es un momento donde sus recursos están limitándose día tras día,  ya que por diversas condiciones el sueldo se está reduciendo.
Desde que empezó a estudiar enfermería y con el pasar de los días, ve cada vez más cerca la posibilidad de  ser médico, la medicina y poder ayudar a otros es lo que la apasiona y ahora mientras se encuentra en prácticas en varios hospitales ve como el sueño que tiene  empieza a tomar forma, sin embargo el sueño va más allá y sabe que la enfermería constituye solo un peldaño que le dará crecimiento, convirtiéndose en la fuente de recursos que más adelante con dedicación, esfuerzo y ahorro garantizaran el ingreso a la universidad. 
La enfermería garantizará un ingreso estable, darle el apoyo a el sobrino, ya que llego al mundo con problemas de aprendizaje, la enfermería también la ayudará pagar la manutención y posteriores especializaciones para ir ascendiendo laboralmente en busca de mejores ingresos. 
Esta carta fue escita con un objetivo, conseguir ayuda de kiva para dar continuidad a un sueño, para romper un ciclo que injustamente le toca vivir a muchas personas en este país solo por ser pobres, este convenio le garantiza  a personas emprendedoras ayuda para que estos a la vez extiendan esa ayuda a otras personas que necesitaran de ellos más adelante.

Gracias
texts.en:
This letter is once more proof of the enterprising spirit and driving talent of a woman who believes in herself and who is building the future. 

Since she was little, she has always valued what she has, but she doesn't limit herself to that. She knows that the world has more to offer her and that she doesn't want to deny herself parts of the world. She also knows about potential and she knows she can contribute something to the building of a better country. Like many people in this country, when she carries her life's flag forward, she faces obstacles that try to stop her from reaching her goals. Nonetheless, perseverance, optimism, and the always unconditional help from selfless people along the way are part of the necessary conditions for her to get ahead, from the darkest shadow to the budding of a dream. 

Xiomara, who is writing this letter, grew up in a neighborhood that was a little harsh and difficult for a girl like her. But this wasn't the end that was awaiting her. That is why she decided to go down the difficult road and not just go with the flow. She set a goal and started to work for herself. She wants to be a doctor and help children in the community where she lives, doing everything possible to ensure that these children have a window of opportunity so that these innocents can have the dreams that define them come true. Right now she is studying nursing. She is in her third semester and she is more motivated than ever. The expectations that she had at first have been achieved satisfactorily. Right now, she is certain of finding the path she wanted. She is decided to go down the road till the end. That is why today she works a half shift as a domestic assistant, receiving half a salary to pay for the ticket to get to where she wants. Nonetheless, this is a time when her resources are limited day to day, since because of different reasons, her salary is being reduced.  

Since she started to study nursing, and as the days go by, she sees the possibility of being a doctor get closer everyday. Medicine and being able to help people are her passion and now she is doing her training n several hospitals she sees how the dream that she has is starting to take shape. Nonetheless, the dream goes beyond that and she knows that nursing is only a step that will help her grow, becoming a source of income that in the future, with dedication, hard work, and savings, will guarantee her going to the university.
 
Nursing will guarantee her a stable income, and allow her to support her nephew who came into the world with learning problems. Nursing will also help her to pay for tuition and later specialization to keep ascending in her work, seeking better income.  

This letter was written with the purpose of getting help from Kiva to continue with her dream, to break the cycle that many people unfairly have to live in this country because they are poor. This agreement will guarantee help for enterprising people so that they can in turn extend that help to people who need it in the future.  

Thank you.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's enrollment.

loans.name: Coeur Angelique De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Ulrick est le coordinateur de son groupe Coeur Angelique de Ouanaminthe. Il est marié, Il a 4 enfants, Il habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitee. Il dirige son commerce de vente de tennis et de souliers pendants les 10 dernières années.

Ulrick votre prêt va investir dans l'achat de chaussures sportives (tennis) et vetement. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce. Des autres membres Coeur de Ouanaminthe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel ques ventes de produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses etc Il déclare que son défi principal est devenir un grand commerçant dans le département du nord. 

Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera a construire une grande maison avec l’aide d’Esperanza International.
texts.en:
Ulrick is the coordinator of his group, Coeur Angelique de Ouanaminthe. He is married and has four children, and lives in the northern region of Haiti where electricity is rare and drinkable water is limited. He has been selling sports shoes and other shoes for the past 10 years.

Ulrick is asking for a loan in order to invest in / purchase additional sports shoes and clothes to resell. He hopes this loan will enable him to grow his business. Other members of the Coeur de Ouanaminthe group also need the loan for other commercial activity such as the sale of cosmetics, soft drinks, etc. Ulrick states that his main objective is to become an important business man in the northern region where he lives. By expanding his business, he will be able to build a large house with help from Esperanza International.

loans.use: purchase sports shoes (sneakers) and clothes

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es: Doña Maria Nela es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Es de oficio Modista, se dedica a la producción y elaboración de costuras de Bebe. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que ha logrado satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes a la brevedad posible. Solicita el nuevo crédito para comprar: Tela, Lana, Dacron, Hilo etc. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Nela is from the city of Granada. She is a dressmaker by profession, and makes a living creating and making clothing for babies. She is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito since she has been able to meet the demands of her customers as quickly as possible, She is requesting the new loan to buy fabric, wool, Dacron, thread, and other items. She believes that the loan will be very useful as it will enable her to increase her profits and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, wool, Dacron, thread, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 29, married, and has two children. Due to financial hardships, she runs a small variety store to generate additional income. She has been operating the business for almost two years, and earns an income of PHP 300 daily. 

She aims to increase her income to satisfy their necessities, and save some for the future of their children. 

Due to insufficient capital, she is seeking a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy an additional stock of canned goods, noodles, snack foods, assorted candies, soaps, seasonings, beverages and soft drinks to sell. 

She believes that her loan will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of canned goods, noodles, snack foods, assorted candies, soaps, seasonings, beverages and soft drinks to sell

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Combattans De Sable Group

texts.fr:
Nareus est le coordinateur de son groupe Combattants de Sable. Il est marié, Il  a 5 enfants. Il  habite dans la région nord  d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitee.  
   
Nareus est un charpentier et il va acheter des bois pour en faire du planche pour revendre. Avant de ce trafique ce commerce Il était  un  cultivateur. Il  espère que cet emprunt l’aidera a changer le plan de parce qu il aimerait a contruire un epicerie


Des autres membres de COMBATTANTS de sable ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce telques : ventes produits de  cosmétiques boissons gazeuses etc.  Il déclare que son défi principal est de devenir un  grand commerçant  dans le département du nord.

NAREUS  dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera  a construire une  grande epicerie  avec l’aide  d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Nareus is the coordinator of his lending group, Combattants de Sable. He is married and has five children. He lives in the northern region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and drinkable water is very limited.

Nareus is a carpenter, and purchases wood that he turns into boards that he sells. Prior to this, he was a farmer. He hopes this loan will allow him to grow his business, and he has larger ambitions to build a grocery stand.
   
Other members of the Combattants de Sable group need loans for other commercial activities, such as the sale of cosmetics, soft drinks, etc. Nareus states that his ambition is to become a well known business man in the region in which he lives. Expanding his business, with help from Esperanza International, will allow him to build a grocery stand in the future.

loans.use: purchase wood

loans.name: Dannyboy

texts.en:
Dannyboy is married and has three children; he provides for the needs of his family from the little earnings he gets from the farm. 

He has grown coconut and corn for many years, and he earns well from it. 

He plans to buy coconut farmland near his own farm. Without hesitation, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC, which he had joined recently. 

Dannyboy is determined to improve the farm for a better source of income for the family's future.

loans.use: to buy farmland to grow coconuts

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. Cecile has been in this business for five years now.

Cecile requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business.

In the future, Cecile would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business

loans.name: Kamboinse Bonswende Group

texts.fr:
Mme YAMBA dite FATIMATA représente le groupe KAMBOINSE BONSWENDE.  Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des produits de beauté depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Sankar yaar. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 30paquets de mèches,  70boites de pommade et 04 douzaines de boucles  d’oreille.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique, mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yamba, known as Fatimata, respresents the Kamboinse Bonswende Group.  She is doing very well.  She is married and has six children.  The eldest child is twenty-eight years old, and the youngest is nine years old.  Two of her children attend school.

Yamba has been selling beauty products for nine years.  She buys her supplies in Sankar Yaar, and sells to both men and women.  She will use her loan to buy 30 packets of hair extensions, 70 jars of skin cream and 4 dozen earrings.

Yamba will reinvest her earnings into her business.  In the future, she would like to open a large shop, and be able to provide better for her family.

loans.use: to buy 30 packets of hair extensions, 70 jars of skin cream and 4 dozen earrings for resale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 32-year-old hardworking lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  Her main business is a retail shop, the business she started with a vision of having a personal income. 

She mainly faces challenges of low capital and customers who don't pay her on time; however, she has a dream of having a well stocked shop. 

Edith has asked for a loan to add more stock in her shop to sell.

loans.use: To add more stock in her shop to sell.

loans.name: Khoen's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Khoen is 32 years and married. She has five children, four of whom are in school, while one is too young for school. 

To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her family about 37,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Khoen has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food and for her children’s education. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for cutting the rice. 

She hopes to get more crops from the rice paddy to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for cutting the rice

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sitha is a 52-year-old married mother of three children. 

Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 10 years, and to better support the family and help to earn more income, she also makes snacks to sell. Together, she and her husband can earn about 48,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs; they manage to save about 23,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Sitha has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. 

Now she is leading her group of four to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for cutting the rice, and will use a portion of it to spend on making snacks to sell. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for cutting the rice

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a first-time borrower of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI). He is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 shillings. He is married and has four children. He is a permanent resident of Ndejje, a trading center located at the outskirts of Kampala city. He has been selling pork at the trading center for over four years. With his income, he is able to provide for his family by paying for school fees and other necessities. Andrew says that he has also acquired a plot of land in the same trading center.

He says that the business is doing well in terms of sales, which has enabled him to start constructing six rental units on his plot. However, he needs much more money to complete the rental units, which is why he is applying for a loan. He hopes that he can have a steady flow of income. This will enable him to take his children through school, to pay off his loan, and to get subsequent loans whenever he has a shortfall.

loans.use: to complete construction.

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Cornelius lives in Cherengani, outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations with its peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Cornelius is single and has been farming for two years. He is currently growing maize, beans, and vegetables. He is next to the forest, which will be of great benefit to his bee colonies as they will have access to a variety of local trees and shrubs.

Cornelius is excited to start beekeeping because it is a low-impact business that requires little effort and takes up little land. This is Cornelius’ first loan. He plans to use the income generated from his hives to invest in projects and inputs for his farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth lives in Cherengani, outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano. The volcano's substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Janeth is married and has three children. She works as a businesswoman while her husband farms their land, growing vegetables, tomatoes, maize and potatoes, and tending to a tree plantation.

This is Janeth’s first loan. She plans to use the income generated by her beehives to help pay school fees and invest in her land. She is excited to start beekeeping, as she thinks it is an easy business that also has benefit in the form of crop pollination.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es: El  señor Valentín  tiene 60 años de edad estudió hasta nivel básico y no pudo continuar sus estudios a nivel superior por falta de recursos económicos, es de estado civil soltero.Desde muy temprana edad se dedica a trabajar como agricultor para tener un futuro más próspero, actualmente tiene plantaciones de yuca y citricos en ocasiones sus vecinos o amigos le ayudan a cosechar sus cultivos, y cuando ellos no pueden, utiliza personal eventual. Dado que no tiene muchos ahorros, solicita un crédito para construir su casa porque lamentablemente por la humedad que existe en el trópico el lugar donde vive tiene goteras por todo lado, por ello requiere el préstamo, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Valentin is 60 years old and completed high school. He could not continue his education as he did not have enough money. Valentin is single and, since he was very young, he has a worked as a farmer so that he could have a more prosperous future. Valentin currently grows yucca and citrus fruits and, on occasions, his friends and neighbours help him to harvest his crops. When they cannot help he hires temporary labourers. As he does not have many savings, Valentin is applying for a loan to build a house Unfortunately, due to the tropical climate, his home has damp and so he needs a loan in order to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Assurance De Phaeton Group

texts.fr:
Jaccint est le coordinateur de son groupe Assurance de Phaeton. Il habite dans la région de Phaeton où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. 

Jaccint a dirigé son commerce de poisson pendant les 10 et demi dernières années. Il est marie il a 4 enfants. Jaccint voudrait utiliser cet emprunt d'investir dans l'achat de poisson. Jaccint espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son entreprise.

Des autres membres Assurance ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, vetements usees et produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
Jaccint is the coordinator of the 'Assurance de Phaeton' Group.  He lives in the Phaeton region where electricity is rare and water is very limited.

Jaccint has been working as a fish salesman for the past ten and a half years.  He is married and has four children.

Jaccint will use his loan to invest in stocks of fish.  He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business.

The other members of the group will use their loans for their businesses, selling charcoal, second-hand clothes and food products.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.en:
Olimjon is kind man. He is married and has two children; he is a very hardworking man. 

Olimjon provides services to local people as a master of repairing houses; he has an assistant. Olimjon has worked in this field more than three years. 

Olimjon also is a student of the Technology Tajikistan University; he studies well, but in absentia. 

He must pay for tuition, but he doesn't have money. He is the main income earner of the family. 

He is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to pay for tuition. 

He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Jose Alvaro

texts.es: El Joven José de 21 años de edad es de estado civil soltero,  tiene una instrucción de nivel primaria y no pudo continuar con sus estudios por falta de recursos economicos, pero es muy emprendedor, actualmente vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Económicamente es independiente de sus padres, trabajo desde los 18 años como ayudante albañil. Como no tiene muchos ahorros, solicita un crédito para comprar herramientas y equipos de construcción como mezcladora, amoladora y sierras, de esta forma lograra trabajar de manera independiente como albañil constructor y podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos para cubrir todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Young José is 21 years old, single and lives in the city of Cochabamba. He completed primary school but could not continue his education due to a lack of money, José is, however, very enterprising and is financially independent from his parents. He has worked as a builder's assistant since he was 18 years old. As he does not have many savings, José is applying for this loan in order to buy building tools and equipment, such as saws, a mixer and a knife grinder. With these tools he can then work as a private builder and will be able to increase his income, cover all his costs and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building tools and equipment, such as saws, a mixer and a knife grinder.

loans.name: Uwe Macho Group

texts.fr: La cliente Lokeso est une commerçante et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Uwe macho », entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mariée  et mère de 3 enfants qui  tous, étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des huiles de palme. Elle étale sa marchandise  dans un marché de la ville.  Elle commença ses business avec  de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 50 litres d’huile de palme. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital,  scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Lokeso is a shopkeeper and a member of the « Uwe macho » group. She is a 33 year old entrepreneur, married and the mother of three children all attending school. She sells palm oil in the market of the city. She began this business with funds from her husband, who is a civil servant working in the local government. She has been involved in this activity for the past four years. This loan will enable her to purchase 50 liters of palm oil, allowing her to increase her revenues, and educate, clothe and feed her children. She would like to profusely thank Herkima for enabling unbanked female entrepreneurs to become empowered, notably during this critical post-conflict context in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: purchase 50 liters of palm oil

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mutundwe Community Development Group

texts.en:
Benjamin is a member of the Mutundwe Community Development Group; he is 38 years old, and married with two children who both attend school. In addition, he looks after his brothers in the village.

He is a primary school teacher, and also has a small retail shop in Mutundwe. Benjamin started this business to supplement his small salary that he gets from his teaching services.

Benjamin, however, lacks capital to expand his business, so he is requesting a loan to buy retail stock and boost his income. 

He is hard-working and innovative.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Umoja Ni Nguvu I Group

texts.fr: La cliente Véronique est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires « Umoja ni nguvu I », entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 5 enfants qui  tous, étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des pommes de terre. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un marché de la place. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 100 kilogrammes de pomme de terre. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, nourrir et assurerles soins médicaux de ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflit à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Véronique is an entrepreneur, trader and member of the business group 'Umoja ni nguvu I'.  She is forty years old and has five children, who all attend school.  She has been selling potatoes at the local street market for four years, and began her business with money she received from her husband.  Her husband works in public administration.

Véronique later began working with the field partner, Hekima.  She will use her loan to buy 100 kilogrammes of potatoes.

Her earnings will provide for school fees, health care and food for her children.

Véronique is very grateful to Hekima for helping non-bankable, women entrepreneurs become independent, particularly during this crucial time of conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 100 kilogrammes of potatoes for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is 48 years old. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is raising 5 children with her husband and both of them work hard to meet their needs. To cover their expenses, they are engaged in breeding livestock (cows and hens) and cultivating apricots, apples, pears, and walnuts.

In the present, it is very difficult for the family to fully cover their needs. This is why Sevda wants to increase their livestock a little bit. She needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to purchase two steers and forage. Sevda and her husband rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for helping sustain their lives.

loans.use: to purchase two steers and forage.

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta is an unmarried 26-year-old woman who lives in Airport community with three children between the ages of 4 and 9 years old. The children are in school and live at home. Her fiancé is a house builder.

For the past 10 years she has been selling rubber dishes (plates, bowls, cups, spoon, etc.) in the local market. Teta says she received a little amount from her mother to get involved with business. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business (plates, bowls, cups, spoon, etc.). She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en: Tofiq is a 48-year-old married person. He lives in the countryside and has good opportunities to expand his livestock and farming business.  He has a great deal of experience since he has been a farmer for more than 15 years.  Because his livestock is always in good health, Tofiq has many regular clients.  He wants to expand his business and have higher monthly profits.  He is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to purchase more livestock.  He plans to use to profits from the loan to improve his living situation. Tofiq hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 38-year-old man who is married to Florence and blessed with four children, ages 3 to 16 years old.

He sells and makes new clothes, a business he has been doing for the last 25 years. He earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. David is taking his first loan to buy more raw materials for making new clothes to sell. He will use the profit to repay the loan.

His dream is to own a big boutique and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric materials for making new clothes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña María, sola ha  buscado la manera de salir adelante junto a sus hijos quienes ahora son independientes, teniendo bajo su cargo al menor que cursa el último año de la escuela secundaria, siendo madre soltera ha trabajado arduamente como empleada domestica para mejorar las condiciones del hogar y brindar a sus hijos los estudios. Siempre preocupada por mejorar su vivienda solicita este crédito para cambiar las láminas de zinc en el techo del cuarto los cuales están en muy malas condiciones de habitar.
texts.en: Alone, María has looked for a way to prosper with her children, who are now independent adults. She still has one son whom she looks after - he is in his final year of high school. As a single mother, María has worked hard as a domestic servant in order to improve life at home and to give her children an education. María is always looking for ways to improve her home and is applying for this loan in order to change the zinc laminate sheet on the roof. They are currently in very bad condition.

loans.use: to buy zinc laminate sheeting and purlins.

loans.name: Cruz Adelina

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar  se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señorita Cruz, tiene 48  años de edad, está soltera y vive en compañía de un hermano, ella al igual que su hermano sufre de una enfermedad, pero más le afecta a su hermano pues él está ciego.
Doña Cruz  para salir adelante y con esto sacar adelante a su hermano desde hace varios años surtió una pequeña  tienda de víveres que con el paso del tiempo y con la ayuda de los créditos la ha ido mejorando, allí además de vender víveres también vende productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja en compañía de su hermano pues tiene que cuidarlo además de realizar sus labores, ya son más de 15 años que lleva con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos. Lleva 11 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante hasta que Dios se lo permita.
texts.en:
The Virgen  Del Mar credit group meets every 15 days in the beautiful San Mateo spa neighbourhood in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular with foreign and national tourists year-round. Here, most of the inhabitants work as fishermen or in other sea activities. 

Señorita Cruz lives here. She is 48 years old, single, and lives with one of her brothers. Like her brother, she has an illness, but it affects her brother more because he is blind. To support herself and her brother, a few years ago Cruz set up a small shop selling basic items, which over time and with the help of loans has gone from strength to strength. In addition to selling provisions, she also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, and women's' accessories). She works with her brother, because she has to look after him as well as make a living. She has had this business for over 15 years, which allows her to move forwards.

She will use this loan to buy more stock for her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other items. She has been a member of the credit group for 11 years, and she likes it because thanks to the loans she is able to move forwards. Her dream is to continue working for as long as God allows.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and other products.

loans.name: Virgen De La Luz  (Manta) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Virgen De La Luz se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Mirador en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás  y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como, comercio en general, venta de comida, servicios, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Marilin, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada   y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 3 años, el  mayor  estudian en colegio. Su esposo es obrero.
Doña Marilin  es una muy buena ama de casa que además de atender a su marido y sus hijos se dedica a la preparación  y venta de comidas rápidas, ella los tres últimos días de la semana instala un pequeño local en su casa en el cual en las mañanas vende encebollados y ceviches de pescado y camarón, mientras que en las tardes y noches ella prepara hamburguesas, empanadillas, hornados, corviches, pastelillos entre otros, lleva más de 10 años con su negocio con el cual ayuda a su familia a tener un mejor porvenir.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar víveres para la preparación de los alimentos, jugos, aguas y gaseosas. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le brindan los créditos Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The "Virgen de la Luz" loan group meets every fortnight in the El Mirador barrio of the city of Manta - a city known for its beautiful beaches which are popular all year round. Known for its unbeatable beauty, Manta has many tourist attractions.

This group of people decided to come together to create a loan group some time ago. The group has been of great help to the members as, with the loans, they have improved their small businesses. The members do different work including running general businesses, selling meals, offering services and other work.

One member of the group is 35-year-old Marilin. She is married and, with her husband, has two children, aged eleven and three years old respectively. The eldest child is in school. Marilin's husband is a labourer.

Marilin is a good housewife and, as well as looking after her husband and children, she makes a living preparing and selling fast food. The last three days of every week, Marilin opens a small restaurant in her house where in the morning she sells shrimp and fish ceviches and in the afternoons and evenings she sells hamburgers, savoury pastries, meats, fish dishes, small cakes and more. Marilin has had the business for ten years and, with it, she is helping to give her family a better future.

Marilin is going to use this loan to buy supplies for preparing her meals, as well as fruit juices, water and fizzy drinks. Marilin has been with the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because she has always been given loans. Marilin's dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fruit juices, water and fizzy drinks

loans.name: Sokhen's Group

texts.en:
Sokhen is 59 years old and widowed. She lives with her children in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has three children. Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for ten years. She also works for others for a fee to earn additional income. With the current business, she can earn approximately 32,000 KHR per day and save about 17,000 KHR each day for the future needs.

This is the first micro-loan for Sokhen with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sokhen will use her portion to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes to  harvest and collect rice in a timely way so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice

loans.name: Maa Bhagabati Shg Group

texts.en:
This Maa Bhagabati SHG self-help group has 14 members, all women, who live in a small village in Odisha, India.The people here are friendly and kind and have hands skilled for doing all sorts of artisan work. The members of this loan group are very good friends and share a common goal - to give their children a better quality of life.

One member of this group is 42-year-old Pratima. In the picture, the lady standing with a raised hand is Pratima. She is married and has two children. The elder is married and lives apart. The younger daughter is attending the local school. The family owns the house where they live. Pratima's husband works as a daily laborer.

Pratima has cattle, the milk from which she sells. She also raises and sells chickens. Pratima grows crops for home consumption and, if there is any left over, to sell. In addition to this, Pratima sells homemade ice cream.

This loan will be used to buy a cow and its fodder and a chick and its feeds. Pratima's goal is to have more cattle of a higher quality.

loans.use: To  buy a cow and its fodder, chicks and its feeds

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 20-year-old single man who has been working in agriculture and cleaning work since January 2012. He works on a daily basis on customers' needs. He works in any job that provides him with a good income to support his living. He works on cleaning streets and gardens in addition to any other requested service. He doesn't feel ashamed of any service he provides since it comes with a good income that will improve his living.

He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a necessary washing machine which he needs since he lives alone and needs to do his laundry by himself. Hassan hopes that in the future he can manage his career path and start a business of his own once he saves the necessary capital required to start any productive business.

loans.use: To buy a necessary washing machine which he needs since he lives alone and needs to do make his laundry by himself.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina has been earning  from her coconut farm for years. Her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to buy fertilizer was successfully repaid for she earns well from her farm. Recently, she took a new loan to finance the costs of fertilization and weeding maintenance of her farm. Rizalina plans to cultivate the farm to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to finance the costs of fertilization and weeding maintenance of her farm.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 18 años de edad es soltera tiene un 1 hijo vive con los padres y con el hijo en Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Ríos. 

Es integrante de la ventanilla de la Virgen de Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicado en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al cantó Pueblo Viejo. 

Carmen se dedica a la venta y ala siembra de maíz y arroz y a la crianza de pollos.

Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno y la compra de insumos fertilizantes abonos insecticidas y morocho para las gallinas. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas y los vende en la misma localidad. La meta es preparar el desmonte a tiempo para obtener una buena produccion y aumentar la procuccion.

Enfrenta desafios como las plagas y enfermedades que dañan el cultivo. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y cuidar de la hija.
texts.en:
Carmen is 18 years old, single, and has a child. She lives with her parents and child in Ríos Province, Ventanas Canton. 

She is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe community bank, which is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche belonging to Pueblo Viejo Canton. 

Carmen makes a living growing and selling maize and rice, and rearing chickens.

She is requesting a loan to lease land and buy inputs such as fertilizers, compost, insecticides and corn for her hens. She does her buying and selling in Ventanas. Her aim is to prepare the land in time to achieve a good yield and increase output.

Carmen faces challenges such as pests and diseases which damage her crops. In her free time, she enjoys playing sport and looking after her daughter.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as fertilizers, compost, insecticides and corn for her hens.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 59 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, etc. to sell. Juanita has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sradhanjali Shg Group

texts.en:
Sradhanjali SHG self-help group consists of ten women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves and share their problems and to solve their problems among them. All the members of this group are engaged in different business activities like milk selling, flower plant selling, fish selling, etc., so that they can make money to better help and support their families. 

One of them is Basanti, who was selected as the president of this self-help group. The lady standing with a raised hand in the photo is Basanti. Basanti is 23 years old and is living with her husband and her one child, age four years. She hopes to build a house for her family. She has a four acre plot of land in her village, and she is utilizing her land in paddy (rice) cultivation. Her husband is supporting her in this activity.

Basanti has requested a loan of 150,000 Indian rupees (INR) for her group. She will use her portion to purchase the required resources for paddy cultivation. She says a portion of the loan will help her to purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides and cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.name: Xanim

texts.en:
Xanim is 40 years old, married, and together with her husband she is bringing up 3 children. Xanim is happy with her children. She has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Xanim raises livestock, having started 13 years ago. Thanks to the hard work of Xanim and her husband, the homestead currently has one heifer, five sheep, and ten goats. 

Also, on the territory of the house, Xanim has a small garden with apple and plum trees. In the autumn after collecting the crop, Xanim prepares jam and compotes for her family from apples and plums. The remaining portion of fruit and berries are sold. Their monthly income consists of about 200 AZN. 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Xanim turned to Aqroinvest CU and Partners for a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy sheep in order to increase their livestock headcount. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy sheep to increase their livestock headcount.

loans.name: Tocte  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Tocte está formado por 9 mujeres quienes laboran a diario en las tareas del campo como es la crianza de animales y la agricultura, algunos laboran en la ciudad realizando varias actividades, son personas amables, gentiles que laboran a diario para mejorar la economía de sus hogares y para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, aún mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, lugar que está lleno de vegetación y verdes campos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Aurora, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque les inculcan a la unión del grupo, a la solidaridad y esperan cumplir sus metas en conjunto.
La Señora María Aurora tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos tres de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus tres hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña María Aurora toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura lo que es para el consumo de su casa, también cría cerdos, cuyes, pollos y ganado del cual vende la leche.
 El dinero de su crédito va a invertir para la compra de abono para sus potreros y en alimento para sus animales. Su meta es tener más animalitos.
texts.en:
the "Tocte" communal bank is made up of 9 women who work in the fields daily in tasks like raising cattle and agriculture. Some also work in the city doing a variety of things. They are friendly, gentle people who work every day to improve their household finances and offer a better future for their children. They maintain the culture and traditions of their villages. They live around the parish of  Jadan in Cuenca, a place full of vegetation and green fields. 

One of these members is Maria Aurora who enjoys these loans because they invoke a unity in their group, solidarity and the desire to meet their goals together. Maria Aurora is 63 years old, married and has 6 children from this union. Three of the children are married and live with their families. The three single ones work and help with the family's finances. Her husband works in agriculture. They live in their own house. 

Maria Aurora has worked in agriculture all her life. They consume the product in their home. She also raises pigs, guinea pigs, chickens and milk cows. The money from the loan will be used to buy fertilizer for her fields and feed for the animals. Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio tiene 61 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon un distrito que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas e la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillo, desde hace más de 10 años, por lo que es conocido en la zona, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un crédito de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para elaboración de ladrillo y de esta manera abastecer a su clientela que en la mayoría están cambiando la estructura de sus viviendas a material noble.
texts.en:
Herminio is 61 years old. He lives in the Morropon district, a district known for its forests of carob tree. Its population is dedicated to farming, trade and animal husbandry two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Peru.

He has been dedicated to making brick for more than ten years for which he is known in the area. He has a considerable client base. He has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy resources to make brick and, in this way, supply his customers who for the most part are changing the structure of their houses to quality materials.

loans.use: to buy the resources to make brick.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por que su población es hospitalaria ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, cerdos, patos, cuyes, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes a aun mejor precio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago, 43, lives in the Oyotún district. The people here work in farming, selling, and ranching. It is a community known for hospitable people. Oyotún is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

Santiago makes a living by raising and selling farmyard animals, pigs, ducks, and guinea pigs. He is requesting this loan of 1,500 PEN to buy pigs and balanced nutrition to fatten the pigs. This will allow him to offer them to his customers at a better price, which will earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and balanced nutrition.

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es:
Ana tiene 44 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de ica y es madre de 1 hijo. Cada día se levanta muy temprano ya que trabaja como operadora de radio en una empresa de taxis de su ciudad, trabajo con el cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante junto a su hijo.

Ana esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le ha  brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, sobre todo porque presenta varias paredes muy agrietadas, así podrá dar mayor seguridad a su hijo y seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un negocio propio y darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old. She lives in the city of Ica and is mother to one son. Each day she wakes up very early since she works as a radio operator at a taxi company in her city, a job with which she can earn income to be able to get ahead along with her son.

Ana is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help that they have provided, she will be able to buy construction materials to make improvements in her house, especially since it has various walls that are very cracked. Thus she will be able to give greater security to her son and keep working to make her great dream a reality: To have her own business and give her son a profession.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 45-year-old lady from Kilgoris, Kenya; she supports five people in her family.

She sells cereals, a business she has been in for the past five years. She is requesting her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to increase her stock of cereals. She will plow the anticipated profit back into her business.

Her dream is to expand the business and earn enough profit to cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to sell.

loans.name: Bobir

texts.ru: Этого фермера зовут Бобир. Ему 38 лет. Он женат и у него шестеро детей, которым с 1 по 11 лет. Бобир со своей большой семьей, в котором также живут его мать и брат, проживает в районе Джиликуль. Бобир на протяжении 22 лет занимается растениеводством, садоводством и животноводством. Ему помогают брат и жена. Бобир очень опытный фермер. Его труд всегда приносит хорошие плоды. Сейчас Бобир собирается посеять морковь и пшеницу и готовит для этого землю. Он уже закупил семена, а на минеральные удобрения его собственных средств не хватило. Для этой цели он обратился за кредитом.
texts.en: This farmer's name is Bobir.  He is 38 years old and he is married with six children, whose ages range from 1 to 11.  Bobir lives with his large family, which also includes his mother and his brother, in the region of Jilikul.  For 22 years, Bobir has been involved in agricultural work, farming and raising animals.  He is a very experienced farmer and he gets help from his brother and wife.  His work always yields a good harvest.  Now Bobir is preparing to sow carrots and wheat and to prepare the ground for this.  He has already bought the seeds, but he does not have enough money for the fertilizer.  To reach this goal, he has asked for a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en: Janviere is married with one baby child. She is in a new business of selling spare parts for bicycles. She changed her previous business to spare parts after realizing that most people possess bicycles. She wants the loan to buy more spare parts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. She praises the previous loan, which she felt helped her.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for bicycles to sell.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is age 53. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for some time. She has requested the loan to buy more sorghum, beans and maize to sell. The profits will be reinvested in the business. Consolee is very happy for the previous loan that helped her business grow.

loans.use: To buy to more sorghum, beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Kimiya

texts.ru: Кимия 57 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 дочерей. У Кимии - среднее образование, она оптимистично идет по жизни, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. Кимия знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Кимия в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кимии, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь и 28 овец. Для содержания скота имеются все условия: сарай для содержания скота, отгонные пастбища. Дойных коров содержит круглогодично дома, присматривают сами, а овец с марта по октябрь месяцы ежегодно выгоняет на пастбища чабану. Сено и корма для скота заготовлены в достаточном количестве. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кимия обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кимия планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства улучшение материального положения.
texts.en:
Kimiya is 57 years old and she is married with three daughters.  She has a high school education and her outlook on life is optimistic, as she knows exactly what she wants and she seeks it with all her might.  Kimiya knows how to properly spend and budget her money to achieve her goals.  She has been involved in raising livestock for 15 years, which is the main source of income for her family.  Kimiya started this business with the purchase of livestock for 30,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, her farm now has three dairy cows, one horse and 28 sheep.  

She has all the facilities for keeping animals: a barn in which to keep her livestock and pastures for roaming.  Her dairy cows are kept on the farm all year long and she looks after them herself, but her sheep are tended by a shepherd from March to October.  She provides sufficient quantities of hay and feed for the animals.  Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her farming business further, Kimiya has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy cows so she can increase her head of livestock.  She plans to use the income from this loan to further increase her head of livestock, as well as to save up money to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
